text: Common Franklin workflow seems to involve copying content of `__site` from the main branch into the `gh-pages` branch. But "copy a subdirectory into another branch" seems like a very weird thing to do in git. Is there a command to do this?

text:
ah sorry for the frustration Chad, you're using a path that I've not really simplified yet i.e.: running code locally and getting the results to be deployed automatically without re-running it. Using `publish` is one possible way of doing it but clearly not frustration-free.
If you have suggestions for how things could be better, please open an issue on GitHub, I'm sure that'll end up being useful to others too!

text:
Thanks <@UDP5WL2RX>. I think one thing that really threw me was this section:
<https://franklinjl.org/workflow/deploy/#deploying_on_netlify>

This had me thinking I was using a very typical workflow. If I had known I wasn't, I would have brought that up when you were helping me. Also thanks for your time. It was frustrating to have things breaking again, but in the end it helped me understand a little better how things are set up. And I'm very grateful you were able to straighten out the RSS :slightly_smiling_face:

text:
One thing I'm considering is
1. Put `__site` back into the `.gitignore`
2. Have a new directory for deployment, maybe `__production` or something
3. Write a script that deletes `__production`, then copies `__site` into it

The benefit would be that I wouldn't have git bugging me all the time about `__site`, it would just be after running the script.
